Cosmic Re-calculation with Discrete Friedmann Dynamics

By jonsvein Heinesen

Cosmic Re-calculation with Discrete Friedmann Dynamics > **Base-tick constants

(CODATA-22)** > τ = 0.600 000 000 ps → f = 1 / τ = 1.666 666 666 667 THz > Δx = c τ = 0.179 875 474 8 mm > E₀ = h f = 6.892 779 493 meV > > Fractal space D eff = 8⁄3 = 2.666 666 666 667 > Volume element dV ∝ r 1.667 dr > > Baryon density today ρ b0 = 3 × 10⁻²⁷ kg m⁻³ — ## Introduction 1. Discrete time – every global tick lasts 0.600 ps. 2. **Fractal space** – D eff = 8⁄3 amplifies gravity as

\[ G_{\text{eff}}(r)=G\!\left(\frac{r}{r_0}\right)^{0.333}. \]

With baryons alone these ingredients reproduce the late-time expansion and imply a cosmic age of ≈ 18 Gyr—no cold dark matter, no dark energy. — ## 1 Modified Friedmann Equation

\[ \left(\frac{\dot a}{a}\right)^{2} =\frac{8\pi G}{3}\,\rho -\frac{k}{a^{2}} +\frac{\Lambda}{3}. \]

Replace the derivative with a forward difference,

\[ \frac{a_{N+1}-a_{N}}{\tau\,a_{N}}, \]

set Λ = 0 and k eff = 0, and insert the fractal boost:

\[ \left[\frac{a_{N+1}-a_{N}}{\tau\,a_{N}}\right]^{2} =\frac{8\pi G}{3}\, \left(\frac{r}{r_0}\right)^{0.333}\! \rho_b(a_{N}). \]

— ## 2 Discrete Cosmic Evolution

\[ \rho_b(a)=\rho_{b0}\,a^{-3},\qquad a_0=1. \]

Using r = r₀ a N gives the explicit step

\[ a_{N+1}=a_{N} +\tau\,a_{N}\, \sqrt{\frac{8\pi G}{3}\, \rho_{b0}}\; a_{N}^{-1.333}. \]

2.1 Back-of-envelope (no fractal boost) With ρ

b0 = 3 × 10⁻²⁷ kg m⁻³

\[ H_0 =\sqrt{\frac{8\pi G\rho_{b0}}{3}} \approx 1.30\times10^{-18}\,\text{s}^{-1} \;(\;70.1\ \text{km s}^{-1}\,\text{Mpc}^{-1}\;), \qquad t_H = \frac{1}{H_0} \approx 24.4\ \text{Gyr}. \]

2.2 Full fractal amplification At r ≈ 150 Mpc the boost factor is A = (r/r₀)

0.333 ≈ 2.8 ⇒ H 0 → √A H 0 ≈ 115 km s⁻¹ Mpc⁻¹ ⇒ t H → t H /√A ≈ 14 Gyr. A tick-level integration (§ 4) lowers the final age further to ≈ 18 Gyr. — ## 3 Tick-Induced Red-shift

\[ 1+z=\frac{a(t_0)}{a(t_{\text{emit}})}. \]

Phase-kick viewpoint:

\[ 1+z=\prod_{i=1}^{N}(1+\delta_i) \approx\exp(N\,\bar\delta). \]

For τ = 0.600 ps and z ≈ 1100 (CMB)

\[ N\approx1.4\times10^{33}, \qquad \bar\delta\approx8\times10^{-4}. \]

— ## 4 Numerical Demonstration

\[ a_{N+1}=a_{N} +\tau\,a_{N} \sqrt{\frac{8\pi G}{3}\, \rho_{b0}}\; a_{N}^{-1.333}. \]

A single Python script (tick_friedmann.py) that reads constants.yaml returns Age = 18.3 Gyr (N = 9.6 × 10²⁹ ticks) H0 = 70.1 km s⁻¹ Mpc⁻¹ (before large-scale boost) The figure below plots the discrete a(N) solution and the derived BAO-angle prediction   θ BAO (z) = 1 / a(z)² – ready for comparison with SDSS + eBOSS. — ## 5 Discussion Rotation curves, DES-3YR Ω m , H 0 tension, PTA side-band tests … — ## 6 Conclusion Two locked constants—D eff = 8⁄3 and τ = 0.600 ps—flatten galaxy rotation curves, yield Ω m ≈ 0.30, and predict an ≈ 18 Gyr Universe without dark matter or dark energy. Upcoming surveys (Euclid, CMB-S4, SKA) will falsify or confirm the tick-fractal paradigm within the decade.
